definition: a concentrated example of something, to cook until very little liquid is left
details:
noun
- a concentrated example of something
= example: a concentrated example of something
- a concentrated form of a foodstuff
- the desired mineral that is left after impurities have been removed from mined ore
= synonyms: dressed ore
verb
- to cook until very little liquid is left
= synonyms: reduce, boil down
- to be cooked until very little liquid is left
= example: to be cooked until very little liquid is left
= synonyms: reduce, decoct, boil down
- to make denser, stronger, or purer
= example: to make denser, stronger, or purer
- to make more concise
= example: to make more concise
= synonyms: digest, condense
- to compress or concentrate
= synonyms: condense
- to make central
= example: to make central
= synonyms: centralize, centralise
- to direct one's attention on something
- to draw together or meet in one common center
= example: to draw together or meet in one common center
